content: next thread the tapestry needle with the yarn a cast on tail and use this to join the side edges together using mattress stitch when you reach the middle and the change in yarn colour re-thread the needle with the short tail of yarn b and close the rest of the seam fig 2 once the side seam is fully joined the doughnut will be an hourglass shape fig 3 next you will need to turn the work inside-out so that the wrong side of the work is facing fig 4 tie the two yarn a tail ends together to secure them and trim them so that the excess will be hidden inside the finished doughnut tie both yarn b tails ends together but do not trim them fig 4 fig 5 fig 6 © copyright 2019 all rights reserved j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 3 next it s time to prepare the stuffing take a small amount around the size of a golf ball and roll it between your palms to make an elongated sausage shape you want it to be quite soft and open rather than too dense and ideally around 5 inches long it s easier to insert this stuffing once you have started joining the top and bottom edges of the doughnut so next it s time to bring those edges together and join the seam around the circumference of the doughnut thread the tapestry needle with the long cast off tail of yarn b and use it sew alternately behind one \/ stitch on the upper side of the seam fig 5 followed by one /\ stitch on the lower side of the seam fig 6 once you have joined around 4 stitches poke one end of the stuffing through the closed part of the seam continue seaming in the same way enclosing the rest of the stuffing within the doughnut as you go figs 7& 8 as you reach the end of the seam trim any extra stuffing so that it fits neatly within the doughnut and finish closing the seam tie both yarn b tail ends together and sew them through the doughnut before trimming the excess so hiding the ends securely inside fig 7 fig 8 fig 9 well that s your tiny doughnut finished fig 9 if you wish to you can now decorate it with sewn on beads to resemble sprinkles or embroidery to look like drizzled icing see below for some ideas © copyright 2019 all rights reserved j u l i e w i l
